title: Man admits to assaulting a woman with club
title_page: Man admits to assaulting a woman with club
maintext:
A Columbia Falls man admitted on April 20 to allegations that he assaulted a woman with a club.
Randy Gary Young, 51, pleaded guilty to the amended charge of felony criminal endangerment in Flathead District Court in accordance with a plea deal with the state. Young was originally charged with assault with a weapon, his second offense of partner/family assault and criminal destruction or tampering with a communication device.
According to court documents, Columbia Falls Police officers responded to reports of a physical disturbance in December 2016.
Upon arrival, officers reported finding the alleged victim had fled to the reporting personâ€™s residence to use a phone to call 911 after her alleged attacker, identified as Young, took her cellphone to prevent law enforcement from being notified.
The alleged victim told officers Young had attacked her after he had gotten drunk and angry with her. She stated he pinned her to the bed and began repeatedly hitting her.
According to her statement, the woman was able to retrieve a club and strike Young in an attempt to get away. Young then allegedly grabbed the club and held it next to her face as he held her down, stating he was going to kill her.
Judge Robert Allison sentenced Young to three years in Montana State Prison and ordered him to pay restitution to his victim in the amount of $2,600.
